They [the Jewish leaders] took His body down, and laid it in Joseph's new tomb, and rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulcher, stating as their reasons for so doing that His disciples would come and steal Him away by night. Evil angels exulted around that sepulcher, because they thought that Christ had been overcome. A body of Roman soldiers had been stationed to guard the tomb, and the greatest precautions had been
205
exercised by the Jews to make their triumph complete. But heavenly angels were guarding the place where their beloved Commander slept.—RH Oct. 9, 1888.
